alert.note: Alert for Gila (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 13 at 8:11PM MST until August 13 at 11:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Gila County in east central Arizona... * Until 1115 PM MST. * At 809 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in several areas of heavy rain in Gila County including the Gun Creek basin east of Gisela, and the Cherry Creek basin just north of the Salt River. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fort Apache Reservation, Reynolds Creek Group Campground and Rose Creek Campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 288 between mile markers 273 and 296. State Route 188 between mile markers 267 and 268. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
